Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] crawl start & end times

Hi Andrea,

What version of Heritrix are you using?

There was a bug related to askew dates in ARC files vs. crawl.log that 
was fixed in 1.12. For more info on the issue see
http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HER-670

In general, the first and the last line of crawl.log should do what you 
need. The 9th column has 17-digit time stamp that represents beginning 
of the fetch time plus the time in milliseconds that took to fetch a 
document. These two numbers combined should be the same as the 1st 
column date. The first 14 digits of the 9th column's timestamp should be 
the same as in the metaline of an ARC record. Keep in mind that only 
records with positive response codes are written to ARC files.

I hope this helps.

i.



> Hello,
> 
> I'm looking for the best post-crawl report/log/file from which to
> extract the crawl begin & end times. I was using the first & last
> lines of crawl.log for these times but then I noticed that the time
> for the first ARC record occurs slightly before the date for the first
> line in the crawl.log. Is there a better place from which to get these
> dates so that all the ARC record dates will fall within them?
> 
> thanks,
> Andrea
> 
>
